newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-HAMBURG EXPLOIT SPARTAK MOSCOW'S WEAKNESS IN THE AIR.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-HAMBURG EXPLOIT SPARTAK MOSCOW'S WEAKNESS IN THE AIR.

text.p: Hamburg exploited Spartak Moscow's weakness in the air at the back to clinch an impressive 3-0 victory in their UEFA Cup second round, first leg on Wednesday.
Goals from Andre Breitenreiter, Karsten Baeron and Marijan Kovacevic in the eighth, 39th and 58th minutes helped the Germans take a confident step towards the third round.
Felix Magath's team took the initiative early on when Breitenreiter made a late run into the box to head home a cross from the right.

Six minutes before halftime Baeron extended their lead with a clever chip over the Spartak goalkeeper after a well-worked counter-attack down the right. Kovacevic rose at a corner to head Hamburg's third.
Hamburg are seeking their first triumph in Europe since they won the European Cup in 1983, Magath scoring the only goal in the victory over Juventus.
"We knew they might have a weakness in the air and we managed to take advantage of it," Magath said.
